lead_paragraph: The Grand Palais in Paris is perhaps best known for hosting extravagant events like the recent Biennale des Antiquaires antique fair. On Saturday, Oct. 9, however, it will (literally) vibrate to a completely different rhythm, as the second edition of Nuit Electro transforms the glass and iron cathedral of Belle Époque architecture into a vast, pulsating dance floor.
